actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Citizenship, Refugees, Border Security, and International Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement

official_title: To prohibit a convicted sex offender from obtaining approval of immigration petitions filed by the offender on behalf of family members.
short_title: Sex Offender Visa Loophole Elimination Act of 2007
subjects: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

summary.text:
Sex Offender Visa Loophole Elimination Act of 2007 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to prohibit a convicted U.S.-citizen sex offender from filing a family-based immigration petition.

Defines "sex offense" and "specified offense against a minor."

Prohibits approval of a fiance/fiancee or waiting nonimmigrant spouse visa petition filed by a convicted sex offender.

titles.title: Sex Offender Visa Loophole Elimination Act of 2007
Sex Offender Visa Loophole Elimination Act of 2007
To prohibit a convicted sex offender from obtaining approval of immigration petitions filed by the offender on behalf of family members.
